intro: Eugenia perratonii, commonly known as the Perraton's eugenia, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of fragrant white flowers. It produces small, edible berries that are often used in local cuisines. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
